Education, Skills and Labor Market Outc
Viviana V. Roseth, Alexandria Valerio and Carla Solis


Data Set 1 - Variables by Educational Attain
Each tab contains 52 variables that cover:
- Skills acquisition history
- Background conditions
- Self-reported cognitive skills
- Self-reported socio-emotional skills
- Self-repored job-relvant skills
- Labor market outcomes
All variables are organized by educational attainment using ISCED 1997. Based on this classification, data are group
and 1); (2) Lower secondary education (ISCED 2); (3) Upper secondary education (ISCED 3); and (4) Tertiary educati
groups: all adults, which encompases answers of all respondents in urban areas, and youth, which includes only da
extent possible, each variable is accompanied with the specific question used to gather the data. However, for the
multiple questions, the table includes only one of the questions asked as an example. For full access to the questio
http://microdata.worldbank.org/index.php/catalog/step

Citation
“Roseth, Viviana; Valerio, Alexandria; Gutierrez, Marcela. 2016. Education, Skills and Labor Market Outcomes, Data Set 1 - Va
World Bank.



For more information, please contact:
Viviana V. Roseth:     vvroseth@worldbank.org
Alexandria Valerio:    avalerio@worldbank.org


Last update: June 27, 2016
